In 2024, when the Dubai chocolate bar was released, home cooks simultaneously became obsessed with having pistachio cream in their pantries. The spread is nutty, sweet, and rich, and can upgrade anything from humble toast to luxurious tiramisu. Now, this popular paste is available at Costco, and shoppers are racing to get their hands on a few jars.

The spread is made by an Italian brand called Pisti, which specializes in crafting pistachio cream using artisanal methods. A 21.2-ounce jar is available at Costco for $12.49. But unfortunately, you can’t snag one online, it’s only available in stores.

When Costco fans found out that pistachio cream had arrived on shelves, they quickly took to social media to share their excitement and experiences of buying it. One person said, “Omg yesss I want to try making that chocolate bar with this.” Meanwhile, another urged others to keep the discovery quiet to avoid it selling out, commenting, “Please gatekeep this.”

If you have trouble finding the pistachio cream at Costco, don’t worry — it’s available from other retailers online. You can grab the same 21.2-ounce jar on Amazon for $26.40. 

Once you get your hands on this Italian pistachio cream, there are plenty of ways to enjoy it: spread it on warm croissants, use it as a filling for a fluffy cake, stuff it into a homemade Dubai chocolate bar, or drizzle it over a sundae. It’s getting a lot of attention for a reason, so if you happen to find it at Costco, it’s worth grabbing a jar — or maybe even two — to take advantage of the deal.

Buy: Pisti Pistachio Cream, $26.40
